RestaurantInfo.Name: BUON GUSTO RISTORANTE
RestaurantInfo.Address: 2642 W HORIZON RIDGE PKWY, STE A2

Reviews.Author: Luca
Reviews.Content: Somehow I posted on the wrong things so disregard me here I don't know how to delete

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: Food is ok - but waiting 50 minutes for to go order is ridiculous!! Not a do over do to the wait time!

Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch and was pretty excited based on all the good reviews. Unfortunately I wasn't too impressed. Maybe they do Better dinner wise? My boyfriend and I both had sandwiches. They were alright. Only one older gentleman was really doing any work, our server. Willing to give it another shot though. Will probably order dinner to go instead.

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: A few friends were surprised to find such good reviews for a restaurant in this curious location, in a strip mall on the border of a bunch of commercial offices and cookie-cutter residential developments, so I decided to tag along with them. After visiting, we're now only surprised that it got good reviews.  Our experience was very much Jekyll and Hyde. The food was either really good (artichoke appetizer, sausage and mushroom rigatoni, clam linguini) or very disappointing (fried ravioli way overdone, lasagna pasta mushy and falling apart, veal parmesan so smothered in sauce that the breading just fell off).   Same with service:  All the staff were friendly, but service was excessively slow. Slow to get seated, slow for waiters to acknowledge us, slow for food to get out, and slow to get refills and the check. I hate ragging on friendly servers, but when the service is this slow, it's bad service even if they're friendly.  It does not help that value proposition was suspect. Dishes are not large to begin with, plus they give a lot of pasta and sauce but seem stingy on the meat and stuff that matters.  Almost forgot - wine list is very disappointing, but they offer cheap corkage, so bring your own if you insist on coming here. But I'd just as soon recommend to go elsewhere. There are a lot of better Italian options - even in the close-by areas.

Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: Pasta: over-cooked Lasagna, drenched in Cheese, no Bechamel. Pizza: dough and sauce okay, way too much cheese, boring  Service: unattentive old man.  Atmosphere: Vinyl tablecloth, tacky deco, could be in the Bronx  No reason to ever go back.

Reviews.Author: Joan
Reviews.Content: We had dinner here a few weeks ago.  It was fine, but the food was pretty pedestrian.  The wait staff were friendly enough, but not mistake-free.  Our server forgot to bring our soup before bringing our main courses, so he asked if it was ok to bring it to go.  We said yes because our other food was there, but it wasn't really a good solution overall.  At least he could have given us a little bigger amount given the mistake, but we still got just the small cupfuls.  We split a large caesar salad.  It was plain - no shredded parmesan or asiago, just romaine, dressing, and croutons i think (obviously not memorable).  I can't recall what  my husband ate but I had something with the red pepper sauce that is supposed to be one of their signature dishes.  It was just ok.  The ambiance is friendly and homey - vinyl checkered tablecloths.  The prices aren't too bad but I don't think they should be any higher for this sort of place.  I was really looking forward to trying Buon Gusto, which had been recommended to us and was sad to have been disappointed.  Probably won't end up back there as there are a lot of alternatives (Pasta Shop, Ventano's, Gaetano's all nicer, Montesano's seemed like a better deal for the money with similar ambiance).

Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: Had dinner here two hours ago. Dinner was fine it was the price that through me for a loop. Had a 1/2 antipasto which was excellent for $11.95. Ordered s medium pizza with sausage mushroom and anchovies. Received a large pizza. Oh well we'll just take the rest home. The bill came and it seemed like $49.34 was a lot for the salad one glass of wine and pizza. The pizza was $18.95 no problem but $2.75 for sausage, $2.75 for mushrooms and a whopping $$3.50 for anchovies. I had to ask the server if there were mushrooms on the pizza. He said I can see some. $28 for the pizza and hardly mushrooms  or anchovies.  It's a shame. I was there on their opening day in 2002 and been a devoted customer since.  I don't think I'll order pizza there again.

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I ordered takeout which consisted of a meatball parmiagian hero and rigatoni with sausage and mushrooms dinner (which included a salad). The rigatoni dinner was excellent. Delicious sauce with perfectly cooked pasta. The mushrooms were fresh and delicious  and I loved the thinly sliced sausage. The meatball hero was good too though I prefer a meatball with more bread crumbs; the sauce, bread and cheese was very good. The staff was very nice and  the wait time to get my order was fast. I will definitely be back to try more!

Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: Not only was the food AMAZING, but the service was just as great. They were even kind enough to take pictures for us during each of our food courses :) This will be a very special place for us to eat at for years to come and I can't wait to go back again!!

Reviews.Author: Lee
Reviews.Content: Ate here for the first time this weekend and was blown away by the baked eggplant.  The Chef came out and talked to us and he was very friendly, as was the wait staff.  I had a great experience there and the food was amazing.  Do yourself a favor and eat here!!!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I love Buon Gusto Ristorante!   My husband and I had dinner here for the first time a few days ago and I am so glad we did! From the moment you walk in the door you feel as though you've walked out from Las Vegas and into a quant yet classy restaurant somewhere in Italy. The staff was also very professional and quick to fulfill every need.   Right away our server brought out fresh, hot sliced bread with olive oil, garlic and balsamic... Wow! Great start to our meal.. I ordered the pasta with garlic and olive oil which included a salad with their house made ranch(which was creamy and delicious). My husband had the lasagna which came out piping hot.. still boiling in the pan.. I can definitely say that the lasagna was the best I've tasted.. the presentation being a plus. His dinner also included a salad which he upgraded to a caesar salad. To top our meal off, we had Chef Joel's signature bread pudding for dessert. WOW!!!! I would come back specifically for this dish. It was served hot with an addicting rum sauce as well as freshly made whipped cream that had been frozen to deliciousness.    I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone. We cant wait to return.

Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I would never have found this place if my wife hadn't been craving Calamari.  We figured that if we were getting some apps we should go to a place we had never been. She started looking at Italian restaurants that were semi-close to where we live and Buon Gusto popped up.  The reviews were great so we headed on over.   I have driven past this restaurant a number of times and have never seen it.  This place is pretty nice.  It's very small, warm, and welcoming.  The Calamari was very lightly breaded and had the right amount of salt for seasoning.  My wife loved it and even though I'm not the biggest fan, I thought it was pretty great as well.  My wife ordered the Manicotti and it was some of the best I've ever had.  I had the Sicilian Style Eggplant which is baked and topped with Mozzerella cheese.  It was very good and there was a lot of it.  The waitress was great and the timing of the appetizer, salads, and entrees was perfect.  The owner was in the kitchen making pizzas and he was fun to watch and listen to.  I do wish that the food was a couple dollars cheaper for each entree but that won't stop me from going again.

Reviews.Author: Bo
Reviews.Content: I was there yesterday with my one love. And we loving this place. When we get there from the outside it does looks like a Togo place so we get a lil skeptic about it. But we decided to come in anyway. It's a small lil mom and pop restaurant. The service was friendly and good. The food was on point. But the stuffed mushrooms may need lil more works on. Other than that the artichoke was excellent, the sausages and mushrooms rigatoni was so  good. The house soup was wonderful. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Buon Gusto receives my first 5 star review. I base this rating comparing price with quality. This little Italian restaurant in Henderson is a great night out for the value. I had tried both their pizza and the Baked Ziti and all of it was as good as you can get anywhere.   The staff was very attentive and courteous. They handled order changes very well and where gracious to our needs.  The décor was a little dated but could still be considered relevant for a small neighbourhood restaurant.  All in all, if you are looking for a moderately priced Italian restaurant, this is defiantly the place.

Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: I had a really bad experience here in the past, but needed a quick pizza place. The guy at the counter knew me from my review and just apologized in a very gracious way. I felt very special and like they heard my review. I think the pizza is awesome and understand places have bad days.

Reviews.Author: Alana
Reviews.Content: We found this place by chance. We were originally going to go to guisseppes. Thank god we didn't go. This place was amazing. It's a small place but very intimate. Staff was so attentive and welcoming. Food was awesome. I got the lobster ravioli and my boyfriend got the  boo boos baked spaghetti  both were delicious. For dessert we ordered the pumpkin gelato. It was so creamy and hit the spot. Definitely found my spot!

Reviews.Author: Dewey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a new place to try, and we found Buon Gusto on Yelp.  We ordered ahead of time and took the food home, so I can't comment on the speed of their service when you come in and sit down, but we called fifteen minutes before they closed, and they were super nice about taking our order and helping us, which can be pretty rare when people are getting ready to close and looking forward to going home.  A lot of the time when you order to go, the food is cold and not very good by the time you get home, but ours was delicious.  Helpful, cheerful staff, yummy food, and great service?  I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: LN
Reviews.Content: We have gone here for over a year, the food quality has always been average to slightly above average with a few stand outs, such as the potato gnocchi with pesto. Our last few visits have been increasingly disappointing and when we took an out of town guest there recently  and they were out of several items and food was very mediocre, we decided we won't return.

Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: While I was eating my mouth was a bit surprised the flavor was great and the texture was spot on! I have just gotten so used to going out to eat at any Italian restaurant and the pasta simply isn't cooked to the perfect texture. Usually it's too soggy. Most places have good and interesting flavors but who does pasta perfect?

Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: If I could give it 0 stars I would. We have gone here for years and enjoyed the food and service from the family owned restaurant. Well....just went today and either it has changed hands or is under new management. None of the previous family owners or staff were there. It was sooooo dark in the place that we had to use the flashlight on the cell phone to read the menu. We should have left at that point. My partner ordered a lunch special which was a slice of pizza and a side salad. I ordered a hot sandwich which also came with a side salad. I asked what dressings they had and when the waiter mentioned caesar dressing I said I would have that. He then told me that caesar dressing was $1 extra. Told him not to bother. We then ordered our drinks. He never bothered to bring staws and we had to ask for them. About 5 min later my partner was served her pizza and salad. Her salad had ranch dressing on it but you had to really look to find any. Guess ranch is expensive as well?? I got my salad. After about another 5 min I asked if there was a problem with my sandwich and was told rather rudely that it took time and would be ready soon. Another 10 min and my partner had already finished her food and I told they guy to forget the sandwich and bring the bill. He rudely told me it had only been 5 min and it would be ready soon. Anyway he finally bright the bill and had charged us for all the food and drink even though I had cancelled the sandwich before it was served. We gave him a $20 bill and asked for change. The revised bill and change did not show up so went to the counter and told him to give me the change and to revise the bill. Eventually another person came over and revised the bill and we got our change and left. I have not had this rude of service anywhere in years and not once did anyone in the restaurant apologize or even say they were sorry. The pizza was just ok, dont know about the rest of the food.....never got any. The staff even had the nerve to suggest that rather than change the bill they would fix the sandwich to go. It would only take a couple of minutes. !!!! Right !!!!! Anyway dont know when it changed hands but this place is horrible now. Will not go back...you could not pay me enough money to return.  There are many more places to eat in the area and suggest you try any of them....they cant be as bad as this place. No wonder they had so few customers.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: We discovered this gem about a year ago and have been coming back ever since. The staff is amazing, they recognize us when we walk in the door! Their bread is crisp on the outside and warm on the inside, and normally my family will finish at least two loaves.  My parents favorite meal is the veal parmesan, but I love their penne pasta in vodka sauce. My husband loves their baked ziti with sausage. My kids really like their pizza, however they never finish their meal because they eat so much of the bread they serve. We are from New Jersey so it's nice to have a good Italian meal that tastes like back home at really great prices.  One last thank you to the owner and Kimmy you always make us feel so welcomed!!

Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for 9 years.  But I am concerned for the future of this restaurant based on our dining experience last week after the new owner had officially taken charge for over a month.  Apparently you need to be a  friend  for him to even stop to say a word to you.  The food was very good, everything was the same as previous owners' menu except the salad no longer had artichokes.  Already cutting food costs.  Very slow night with something  not working  in kitchen.  And check seemed high for what we had.  Servers were very stressed and we left all stressed out.    I think we'll stick to take out.  The pizza was $4 higher for dine-in than take-out.

Reviews.Author: nikki
Reviews.Content: My favorite little homey Italian joint. Only a few tables, but every things good. I like most of the veal, and the sausage mushroom rigatoni is their star. Pizza isn't perfect, and soups lack some authenticity, but service is warm and welcoming.   We go at least once a month, it's just too cozy not too. Sometimes you can find coupons in the little direct mail coupon books.

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Closed on the day after St. Patty's day. Poor form. I guess business is just that good. Congrats.

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Paid way to much for chicken with No Pasta. Giuseppe's  30yards away just as good if not better and they have a $10 menu

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This place was FANTASTIC!!! I tagged along with my husband on a recent business trip. Wanting to avoid the strip and other crowded establishments I consulted Yelp to find some recommendations. After pouring over the dozens of recommendations we finally decided on this one and could not have been happier! It is a darling little Italian restaurant in a local strip mall and was very clean and welcoming. Our waitress was a young girl- I didn't get her name, but she was AWESOME!! Upon hearing it was our first visit- she went out of her way to explain the menu and give us options that were better than being at home! My husband wanted a very specialized plate that wasn't on the menu and she didn't bat an eye, said it was no problem at all! The food arrived and was absolutely as close to home made as you could ever hope to get! It was the most delicious Italian food I've ever tasted!  I'm not sure if I'll ever tagalong again, but if I do, you can bet that will be revisiting this place again!!! I highly, highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Adriane
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible restaurant. The service was bad, the food was disappointing, and the decorations were corny. We walked into the restaurant at around 4:00 pm and were the only customers. I ordered a lemonade with no ice, however, I received a lemonade WITH ice. This isn't that big of a deal, but we were the only customers. I ordered the New York style eggplant while my boyfriend ordered lasagna. Soup came along with our orders. When we received the soup, it was obvious that they had used leftover pasta from another day. The pasta was in pieces and had different kinds of pasta. When we received the main dishes, and my boyfriend opened his napkin, a bug crawled out!!! Like WTF??? And when he called the waiter over to tell him about the bug, the waiter asked if he brought it with him into the restaurant. The plates didn't look clean either. If we found a bug in the napkins and the plates were dirty, I can't even imagine how unsanitary the kitchen must be. I lost my appetite after the bug incident and we decided to just leave. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I'm someone who if I'm going to spend money on Italian food, I want it to be at least a 4-5 star type place. I really wanted to like this place. The service was excellent. The bread at the beginning of the meal was fresh and delicious. However the pizza was below average. As in I would stay away from ever ordering it again. The lasagna was very good. It tasted a lot like my wife's lasagna which is good, but we both felt to pay to go out we want better than we can make. I will probably try them again down the road to give them a second shot. Just sticking to pasta this time. To put my ranking into perspective... a chain like olive garden would get a 1-2 star from me. So they were better then the pasta co's, littering our nation. If it's this place vs those types of places without a doubt come here. But there is better out there.

Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Talk about a hole-in-the-wall, I have been to this mall a hundred times and never noticed this place until I checked on Yelp for Italian in the area. This is like walking into a small Mott Street eatery. The family loved it, the service was warm and personal, we were treated like family. We had the Veal, Alfredo and Lasagna. All three entrees were excellent with exceptional taste and texture, very authentic NYC fare. My son had enough Alfredo for lunch the next day as the servings are generous. The Gelato after dinner was superb one serving was enough for 3 to share. It might be hard to find, and easily overlooked but it is worth the effort to find this hidden gem.

Reviews.Author: Chandra
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I dinned at Buon Gusto last week after looking online for a good restaurant in the area.  We were attending yet another conference and were in dire need to escape the insincerity of corporate America.  We were promptly greeted by the owner who sat us at a charming table. The service was prompt and the menu was priced reasonably.  The owner took the time to make menu recommendations and answered all questions.  Needless to say, my spinach and Gorgonzola ravioli was exceptional.    What you should really know   At the end of the evening, we were having difficulty getting a cab back to the hotel.  The owner was very attentive and after hearing that we would have to wait 30-50 minutes he promptly took off his apron and directed us to his SUV. In less than 5 minutes we were back at the hotel compliments of Buon Gusto.  After a long week of exhausting meetings and corporate niceties, this was genuine service.  In short, Buon Gusto doesn't do anything different - they just do it better.

Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Haven't had a bad meal here, everything is awesome. Especially their lasagna and lobster ravioli.

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: This is a small italian joint nestled in near Anthem. The food is good and prices are reasonable. The staff is so italian I would be suprised if everyone here is a made man. The stories they have are great and add to the atmospher. I recommend at least trying this place out.

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Went the other night with the fam and had the gnocci with pesto cream sauce...OMG!!! It tasted like little pillows of heaven. Is it sad to admit I'm still thinking about it 3 days after I ate it. Can't wait to go back and have it again.

Reviews.Author: melissa
Reviews.Content: Just wish I had been here before now! Have seen it for years. Finally made it in as a friend took me for bday!!! I am somewhat jaded about Italian because lived in NY for years. Love pasta sauce.. pizza. Atmosphere and service. Great for family night out.. date night. Or take out. Will be back.

Reviews.Author: Misty
Reviews.Content: Omg. The gnocci with tomato cream sauce is TO DIE FOR!! Not to mention the owner and staff are all super friendly and great to visit!!! They just don't make restaurants like this anymore!

Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite Italian places in town, always coming back for more. The manicotti is awesome along with the fresh bread and dipping oil !

Reviews.Author: Deirdra
Reviews.Content: Sooo... On the great reviews of my fellow yelpers we went out and tried this place! Thanks people! We happen to be locals in the area and have never been here.  So glad we did!  Buon Gusto is like your typical Italian eatery in New York.  Looked much like a pizzeria, however, with a dining room that extended a bit back.  The wait was not bad and when we were seated - the servers were attentive.  I ordered the Gnocchi w Tomato Cream sauce and Geo had the Chicken Alfredo. Wow! Both dishes were fantastic!  We also had the Antipasto for an appetizer - too much food for me as a salad came with our meal.  Still, I have to say that it was so fresh that I did not mind eating salad twice.   With all the great choices on the menu from hot sandwiches to perfect pastas to fish entrees... we will definitely be back!  Next time we want to try their lunch specials.  The flavorful food compensates for the lack of pizzazz you would normally seek in a restaurant outing.  We are grateful to have found a great local spot!  I will highly recommend that you come and try it out even if you do not live in Henderson.  I am sure that Dominic, the owner, would love to have ya!   Buona Salute!  your constant companion,  ~deirdra

Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: Great food. Great wine. The food will make your taste buds go wild. I love the fact that its authentic cuisine. Highly recommended!!!!

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: We took a day off the strip to visit some places off the beaten path while visiting Vegas. They have amazing lunch specials! All four members of my family ate (drinks included) for less then $25 and had food leftover. The service was great, we were there during a slower time and they were very friendly and chatty. The chef came out and told us he was making a new sauce for the pizza with onions in it. I would definitely recommend it f you're looking for somewhere that will fill you up with good food with out costing an arm and a leg. And they have free bread and oil & vinegar as well!

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: Best chicken parm ever! The baked ziti was great too!   We will definitely be coming back!  Loved the background music too!  Old school! Staff was fun too!

Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: This is the best Italian place in Henderson as far as I'm concerned. And a bunch of people must agree because the last two times I've been we've had to wait for a table. It's small, but the food is outrageously good. Especially for the price. The team of regular servers that you'll see everytime you go are outstanding. The prices are more than reasonable considering the quality.  Secretly I hope not too many people find out about this place because it's clear they are going to blow up and then it will be impossible to get in. They are destined for a much bigger space. The pizza is excellent, but the pasta dishes are the stars here.

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Are closed on Sundays and not open until 3:30 on Saturdays. So you'll never have lunch there on a weekend. No clue why.  No booths.

Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: Great lunch specials.  Great service and I love there meat ball sandwiches.  Definitely a great local family owned restaurant. An asset to are neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: L
Reviews.Content: It was really good until they changed the owner in March 2013.  Foods were ok but not as good as before.  A little disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Dab
Reviews.Content: Do not come here for lunch.  We were the only table in the restaurant and our food took almost an hour.  We had to get it to-go.  We were told after waiting 30 minutes that there was a catering order ahead of us and that our food was just starting.  We should have been told that from the beginning. After getting back to work and finally being able to eat our food, I was told the pizza was not very good, the fettucine alfredo was bland and my pasta was mediocre.  We also did not get any bread as promised.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: Great food!! Excellent service!! Chicken marsala...new favorite!! Also had chef Joel's homemade bread pudding...let me just say OMG! Awesome!

Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Once again Buon Gusto netted 4-1/2 stars overall after a dinner service.  This time my party of four initially had a long wait for water and butter, but service was otherwise first rate.  Veal Marsala with mushrooms and Marsala Wine Sauce yielded a fine veal entree, except our server reported that the kitchen ran out of veal after fulfilling one order.  So Diane sacrificed, and ordered a different dish.    Chicken Fricasse was a very good soup of the day, paired with fresh Italian Bread.  A Caesar Salad tasted good.  And Spaghetti with Bolognese Sauce and Mushrooms came out fine.  No aioli was available, so we did not order Calamari Fritti this time.  Chocolate and Pistachio Gelati were very good but the Salted Caramel Gelato tasted saltier than I would have preferred.  A special advertised Yelp check in discount of 50% off a second entrée was graciously honored on the spot.

Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem in Henderson! A blink and you miss it sort of place, tucked between a Port of Subs and a shoe repair store. This place is truly a Mom-and-Pop sort of place, homemade meals and friendly service. So far, I've tried the Gnocchi all Vodka and the Chicken Trieste. I prefer the chicken. The gnocchi itself was tender and clearly home made, but the sauce tasted more like a cheese sauce than a tomato Vodka.  The Chicken Trieste consists of thin sautéed chicken breasts in a red wine sauce with mushrooms and artichokes. Your order comes with a side of penne pasta, perfect for the extra sauce with the chicken. The complimentary bread is delicious, pairing well with all of the various dishes. I haven't yet tried the desserts but I plan to!

Reviews.Author: Sassy
Reviews.Content: Go! We didn't even know this place existed. When we walked in we were immediately greeted by AJ.  We were seated within ha couple of minutes. He made recommendations that were very tasty. The best part of this restaurant was the service. Although there was absolutely nothing wrong with the food, AJ was very attentive and polite. He is a great asset to this establishment. I would say to ask for him when you come in , but someone famous is going to steal him away. He is too good to last too long. Love the atmosphere. Also loved being treated like a lady in the restaurant that cost lest than $100 a plate. Ladies know what this means.

Reviews.Author: Erika
Reviews.Content: It is very unlikely and rare that I write a review under 4 stars on Italian eateries, because quite honestly, Italian food is very difficult to screw up. (In my eyes and taste buds at least).   Gave this place a second chance after my first experience was not great. This time I ordered the most basic; pepperoni pizza. Sadly, once again they could not compensate for my first bad experience. My pizza was hard, almost burnt and tasteless. Customer service was also just as bad as the first time, except last time it was a busy night, this time there were only 2 tables being served. Waitress was missing in action for the majority of the time. She seemed very inattentive of our table needs and to top this all off, our pizza was $23 (without tax.)   Not worth the price, will not be coming back.

Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been wanting to try all the little local Italian restaurants in the Henderson area and ate here last night.  Service was great. Food was very good. I had the pizza and my wife ordered Sausage and Mushroom Rigatoni which was great.  We order a Caesar and Side House salad, both were really good.  We'll be going back and only reason for mark down is that the pizza, while good, lacked the wow factor of a few other pizza places in the area.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time after hearing it was good. ..I came in around lunch time and the place was empty. I picked up penne alla vodka to go. It was super watery and had no flavor. The full portion actually looked like a lunch portion. And for $15 including a salad, it was not worth it. This place may have been delicious back in the day, but don't waste your time.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that ever since living in Italy I am extremely picky about Italian food. But, Buon Gusto shines every time. It is a small family run New York style Italian restaurant. The place is tiny, so expect to wait for a table, sometimes up to 30 minutes. Don't worry the food is well worth the wait. They always start you off with warm bread and an olive oil and balsamic dipping sauce. It is perfection, especially after the wait. Your dish will also come with soup or a salad. They have 2 homemade dressings, a delicious ranch and a house oil and balsamic dressing that is fantastic. You can't go wrong either way, but I love to dip my bread in the house dressing. Yum! I have tried quite a few dishes, but here are some of the highlights:  I am in love with the sausage and mushroom rigatoni. It is tossed in a creamy tomato based sauce and just so delicious. You won't ever regret ordering this, trust me.  They make a mean baked ziti as well, their signature pasta sauce is just delicious. You definitely want the sausage, as the meatballs are lacking in flavor.   They also have fantastic thin crust pizza's! I have tried both the California white pizza and Steve's cattleman and they were great. I love white pizza and the California definitely hit the spot. But, they also make a fabulous red sauce so be sure to try that as well. The individual size is perfect for one.  Overall, you will not regret a visit to this small mom and pop shop. The food is delicious and the service is always on point.

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I've only had their Brooklyn Hero...Amazing!  The fresh crusty bread, the meats, cheeses and house dressing was a treat for the palet. I forgot the two guy's names but they were so Brooklynesque in their casual way but so polite and gracious and accommodating to every guest the two times I was in.  I see some negative reviews posted and all I can say is my experience was not yours.  Everyone has a bad day but I got lucky perhaps.   Ah'll be bach!

Reviews.Author: Marlene
Reviews.Content: Just like being back east! Always up to par. Great service, fresh home made food, cozy atmosphere. My favorite place to go to for incredible Italian food. They never cease to amaze. Some of my favorite dishes are the Veal Trieste, chicken francaise, chicken Marsala and rigatoni with sausage. These dishes are mind blowing! Even the traditional eggplant parm or lasagne is made perfectly. They know what they're doing here. Always a favorite!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: The Brooklyn hero was amazing!  The house salad dressing was excellent and service was great.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Coming from the best Italian in Las Vegas I'm gonna tell you where to get the best Italian food.  Coming from jersey it's real tough to find real Italian food. Well hidden away from the neon and chrome of the strip and far far away from dumps like olive  Garden is this gem. I'm addicted to their eggplant parm and their chicken cacciatore is the best I've had since leaving Jersey. Go to this place first chance you get! Go, Now, and treat yo self

Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: Small trattoria tucked away in an Albertson's strip mall. Look for the big yellow shoe/car in the parking lot that is right next door to this wonderful Italian food nook. Fresh dishes with just the right amount of spices! I always bring friends there and they love it!

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I don't understand when people think the food has changed that much since under new management!  The food is still so amazing! Steve and his wife were great and now Tom and his family have come in,  it is still great if not amazing!  The atmosphere is so welcoming with great aromas and smiling staff!  Thank you to Tom and the new management team for keeping it so true to the original!    My wife and I have spread the word to friends and family...all agree the food and service are  STILL amazing!  Thank you Buon Gusto!  Andrew B.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: As always, the food is amazing, tradional flavor, great service. We love it here.  Staff is awesome as well!!!!.

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Awesome authentic Italian food.  This place is a hidden gem. It is a total joke in the wall and it is well worth the trip.  We went with the chicken Marsala and the rigatoni sausage and mushroom. Both were outstanding to say the least.  The tiramisu is to die for if you can save room for desert.  The staff and owner is super friendly.  Had a 20 min conversation w him and it was like we had been friends for years.  This is a must try

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: We decided to come here on a whim wanting to try something new and it was actually really good. My husband got a large pizza with chicken and sundried tomatoes. I ordered the chicken Parmesan.  The pizza was okay but the chicken Parmesan was very very good.  I would come back for the chicken Parmesan for sure!  The manager was very nice and talkative but our actual waiter wasn't that great; maybe it was just an off night for him.  The gelato was super yummy too!

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: While visiting family in the Henderson area we were looking for a late night dinner spot.  Italian sounded good, but we wanted to avoid the chains in the area.  The in-laws had heard of a local place with a good reputation but couldn't remember the name.  A quick search on Yelp narrowed our search down to Buon Gusto. It was the perfect find!   They have a small dining area and take out service.  We opted for dine-in.  A little cramped for our party of 5 but the atmosphere is pleasant and service was friendly and helpful.   The food was fantastic.  The sauces have a great homemade taste and the pasta was cooked very well.   My salad was super fresh and crisp and the house dressing - balsamic vinaigrette -- was lovely.  The star of the table was the Chef Cisco Style Eggplant entree.  A must try.  Sliced eggplant tossed in a marinara rosemary sauce, smothered in cheese and baked.  So amazingly tasty. The other dishes were very good as well.  The one disappointment was the wine by the glass selection.  Very limited and what they had was not good quality. Overall I highly recommend a visit to Buon Gusto.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Well we're do I start.     Ordered a large pie cheese nothing out of the norm and fried raviolis.   The pie took over an hour and it was not like the place was packed.   Very unorganized and the older gentleman with grey hair and a pony tail has the worst attitude.   Won't smile actually looks like he wants to hurt someone.   Food was mediocre nothing to talk about

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Delicious food! Amazing staff! Very cutesy atmosphere! Will definitely be returning here as soon as I am back in Henderson. Excellent prices and delicious options!   I had the sausage and mushroom rigatoni which was amazing! The portions are huge! My niece ordered the kids menu ravioli and there were over a dozen ravioli's in her dish. My sister ordered the spaghetti and meatballs... oh my! The meatballs were delicious!   Amazing little place hidden in a very boring shopping center. However, once you're inside, the interior is amazingly cute. They offer eat-in and to-go orders. Can't wait to eat here again!

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I love this place! My son found it on Yelp and we have dined here 4 times now.  The food is excellent, always Hot and fresh.  The staff is all wonderful.  Great service and good attitudes.  Just a great overall atmosphere.  Keep up the great work! I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: This little hole in the wall packs some big taste. We came to this family-owned Italian restaurant to celebrate our friends' engagement.  They are regulars and said we'd love the food; they were right.  We were greeted warmly and informed that the food would take a bit longer due to a large catering order that the kitchen was also cooking.  No matter since it didn't seem like much of a delay at all.  We enjoyed bread, dinner salads, and conversation before our main courses arrived.  I had the chicken marsala and it was a generous helping of three pieces of moist chicken with a very tasty sauce and lots of mushrooms; I highly recommend this dish!  Believe it or not, I didn't have any pasta, but my friend's spaghetti and meatballs looked delicious.  I love little hole-in-the-wall places like this over a chain restaurant any day. The service is friendly and the food is good. PS-our friends are having Buon Gusto cater their wedding reception, which means I get more chicken marsala tonight--grazie!

Reviews.Author: Moses
Reviews.Content: Had this place the other night. We had the baked ziti with sausage, egg plant parmesean, and garlic bread. The flavor of the food was great, the red sauce tasted like someone spent the time of cooking down the sauce, like homemade sauce my mother in law makes. The prices was a  little inflated is my only complaint. The garlic bread was 6 bucks by itself. Overall though I didn't have to wait long and they made my order quickly. I will definitely come back when I have an Italian food hankering and I don't want to go to the strip. Glad I found this little joint.

Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: Thank you Buon Gusto this is the best  chicken picccata I have had since we have been here... I thought it was hoing to be diffrent w/o linguini noodles but the penne was just enough... Delicious.  THX U KIMBERLY!!!

Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: My good friend grew up in New York City, and Buon Gusto is one of her favorite place to eat in Las Vegas. It didn't take much arm-twisting for her to convince me to try it out for dinner on a recent Friday evening.   The owners hail from Brooklyn and serve up excellent food at fair prices. It's a smaller restaurant, complete with memorabilia from NYC all over the walls. When we arrived it was packed with another party waiting to be seated. Sandi, one of the owners, was working as the hostess and she was great. Not only did she give us a pretty accurate idea of how long we would be waiting, she also came over to let us know when the party seated at the table we were going to be sitting at was done eating.   Our waitress took our drink order and brought out some complementary warm bread and oil to dip it in. We had my friend's two children with her that were starving, so she ordered food for them while I continued to look over the menu. When their slices of pizza were ready, the other owner, Steve, brought them out to our table.  I ended up ordering the spaghetti and meatballs, my friend had the eggplant parmigiana, NY style. I was given the option to switch to whole wheat or gluten free pasta for an additional charge, I didn't do it but like that it was an option. Both entrees came with choice of soup or salad, I chose the salad with house dressing (made in house as all house dressings should be) and she had the soup which was Italian wedding soup. Both of these came out very quickly. The salad wasn't anything to write home about but it the veggies were fresh.   We waited close to an hour from the time we ordered for our entrees to come out. Our waitress was very apologetic, which we appreciated, but she made the mistake of telling us our food should be out in  4 minutes  ( not  a few minutes  which would have made more sense) which of course did not happen.   In the end, the food was worth the wait. The meatballs were excellent, and the portion was massive. I would go back in a heartbeat, just going to make sure I don't have anywhere to be immediately afterward...

Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: Food was on the cold side and tasted like it had been reheated... Ordered chicken marsala and got chicken in a bunch of watery sauce. Prob will not visit here again.

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Delicious!  I've had the lobster ravioli, fettuccine alfredo, mushroom ravioli, and various tortellini dishes.  I love love love their house dressing (Italian type vinaigrette), and the chunk of bread you get with every meal.  We have yet to dine in, as we tend to do a lot of take-out for our date nights while the kids are in bed, but I have no reason to believe it would do anything but improve our opinion of the place!  It's my current favorite Italian place in Vegas/Henderson.

Reviews.Author: P
Reviews.Content: I used to love to love this place! Steve was a great restaurateur! However the new owner should have taken some lessons and certainly not changed the menu. We waited an hour and a half to have our entrees come out looking nothing like what I was used to. The Chicken Francese  came out all mixed together and they put red sauce on it. The sausage on my Dates plate was ground sausage ....which would have never left the kitchen before!  I'm only giving one star because the Drinks were cold and refilled. Saying sorry for the delay and blaming it on staff not showing up only goes so far.....

Reviews.Author: love lv
Reviews.Content: They have new owners, so be patient.  Understand it was a busy night, and the new owners are still trying to get adjusted with the staff so service is slower than usual.  I also got nervous when I heard the owners son is the new chef.. (please don't change all of the recipes)  We were seated about 15 minutes after arrival. Now we waited another 10 minutes before our drink order was taken. Another 15 minutes and our order was taken, and then 20 minutes later our food was served. Yep.. 45 minutes from the time we were seated.   Food was delicious. Gnocchi with Tomato Cream sauce has not changed.. Yay!!! The rest of my party enjoyed their food too.   On a side note, where we were sitting to where I could see the prep area where salad greens were being cut. The knife that was used was rinsed off with the water from the soda fountain. Not sure what was cut with the knife before, but not too sanitary.   Hopefully on our next visit things will be back up to speed and prep procedures will be reviewed.

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: The lasagna is a must!  This is one of those small private owned must try places.

Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Tried them for the 1st time tonight, got a large vegetarian pizza, and it awesome. I'm not vegetarian kinda guy, but it really tasted great. Great toppings and sauce, dough was cooked perfectly. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: wennie
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the pasta's clams is from the Can food & Italian restaurant doesn't serve  capuchino  !!

Reviews.Author: D.
Reviews.Content: I had the chicken marsala linguini excellent and tge Itialian wedding soup was delicious.

Reviews.Author: Janette
Reviews.Content: Great food! Great service! awesome portions! dream about their food after only being there once. Can not wait to return! Love the New York feel but the food comes out like it was made only for you!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to come here a few days ago since: 1. I had never been and 2. she hadn't been in a while. When we go there, the venue was very small, and we had to move the table forward so we could both sit comfortably (I'm 6'8 ).  The waiter was very professional, which was nice to see. He was able to accommodate my friends tomato allergies and make suggestions around it as well. We looked at the menu and almost everything was at least $14. Luckily, we had gotten there around lunch time, so we were able to chose from a menu of $8. Unfortunately, there is no substitutions on that menu, so my friend could only goose from two dishes.   I asked the waiter what the portions were like for the lunch menu, and he said that they were just a smidgen smaller than the dinner plate. We both ordered our drinks and food, and that's when we got bamboozled. They added $3 for the chicken in my chicken Alfredo, and when I asked for caesar dressing, they wanted to up charge me another $2. I said no, so we waited for our meals. My coke was pretty flat, so I was already in a sour mood about that. When the chicken Alfredo got there, it was 40% pasta and 60% sauce. The chicken tasted off and was very watery. We wanted to get dessert, but the next time we saw the waiter, he brought us our check instead of asking about dessert. We took that as a sign and went elsewhere.   Overall: 1 star for atmosphere, 1 star for waiter experience, 1 star for allergy accommodations, -1 star for price/up charging, -1 star for food quality. I probably would not come here again unless I had too, and I probably would not recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic food!  We ordered our meal to-go.  I ordered the  best lasagna you've ever eaten  and let me tell you... it was.  My husband (who is on a low carb plan for eating) had their low carb special with grilled sausage and onions with peppers.  He loved it!  My kids had pizza and thought it was fine.  I tasted the pizza and it was better than average...  The prices were fair, and the quality was superb.  This is my new favorite neighborhood spot for sure.  Next time I will try one of their gourmet pizzas.  The bread that came with my lasagna was delicious.  I wondered if it was the same dough for the pizza.  Thanks!!!

Reviews.Author: Kasee
Reviews.Content: Great place to eat. I love coming here everything is so good and the prices are reasonable. The bread is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Allison
Reviews.Content: I came here on a Sunday afternoon when the dining room was closed but they were cooking orders for pickup. I had a really nice chat with Joel while I waited for my pizza and gnocchi. Nice people run this place and the food is delicious. I've been here several times between 2012 and 2014 and have had consistently good food and good service. It feels good to support local business and be enthusiastic about it. This place has always been great and continues to be.

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Health Grade B.  Do not go here!  This weekend it was close to 80 degrees in there, most of the time you could here people in the kitchen using foul language and their current Health Grade is a B.   Stay away.  Their food sent me to the toilet multiple times.  This use to be my favorite place for pizza in town.
